snippet: Joseph Ponte, the newly appointed correction commissioner, will be up against one of the country’s toughest city jails and one of the most powerful union leaders in the state.
abstract: Joseph Ponte, newly appointed correction commissioner of New York City, will face significant challenge as he attempts to improve conditions at Rikers Island in accordance with mandate from Mayor Bill de Blasio; Ponte, who has a formidable reputation as a reformer, will square off against powerful union leader Norman Seabrook, who opposes his plan to reduce solitary confinement; violence at prison has risen to its highest level in years.
lead_paragraph: Joseph Ponte, the newly appointed correction commissioner, will be up against one of the country’s toughest city jails and one of the most powerful union leaders in the state.

headline.seo: Joseph Ponte, New York City’s New Correction Commissioner, Faces Challenge at Rikers
headline.main: De Blasio Setting Up a Test: Prison Reformer vs. Rikers Island
